history.proof: intros n m p H. apply Ngt_gt. qsimpl time: 1 use: N,mult_gt_compat_rev_l1. qsimpl time: 1 use: N,nat_of_P_gt_Gt_compare_morphism,mult_gt_compat_rev_l1. apply gt_Ngt. qsimpl time: 1 use: N,nat_of_P_gt_Gt_compare_morphism,mult_gt_compat_rev_l1. hcrush use: Ngt_gt, Ngt_gt_rev, N2Nat.inj_mul, mult_gt_compat_rev_l2, N2Nat.id unfold: N.gt.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall n m p : N, N.mul p n > N.mul p m -> n > m

Premises:
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0 => 0 | N.pos p => match m with | 0 => 0 | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
Inductive N : Set := N0 : N | Npos : positive -> N Arguments Npos _%positive_scope
Nmult_gt_compat_l : forall n m p : N, n > m -> p > 0 -> p * n > p * m
Nmult_gt_compat_rev_l1 : forall n m p : N, p * n > p * m -> p > 0
mult_gt_compat_l : forall n m p : nat, (n > m)%nat -> (p > 0)%nat -> (p * n > p * m)%nat
mult_gt_compat_rev_l1 : forall n m p : nat, (p * n > p * m)%nat -> (p > 0)%nat
nat_of_P_gt_Gt_compare_morphism : forall p q : positive, Pos.compare_cont Eq p q = Gt -> (Pos.to_nat p > Pos.to_nat q)%nat
nat_of_P_gt_Gt_compare_complement_morphism : forall p q : positive, (Pos.to_nat p > Pos.to_nat q)%nat -> Pos.compare_cont Eq p q = Gt
Ngt_gt : forall n m : N, (N.to_nat n > N.to_nat m)%nat -> n > m
Ngt_gt_rev : forall n m : N, n > m -> (N.to_nat n > N.to_nat m)%nat
gt_Ngt : forall n m : nat, N.of_nat n > N.of_nat m -> (n > m)%nat
N.le_lt_trans : forall n m p : N, n <= m -> m < p -> n < p
N.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : N, n < m -> m <= p -> n < p
Nmult_reg_r : forall n m p : N, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p -> n = m
N.mul_le_mono_nonneg_r : forall n m p : N, 0 <= p -> n <= m -> n * p <= m * p
N.gt_lt : forall n m : N, n > m -> m < n
N.lt_gt : forall n m : N, n < m -> m > n
N2Z.inj_gt : forall n m : N, n > m < -> (Z.of_N n > Z.of_N m)%Z
Nmult_lt_compat_rev_l1 : forall n m p : N, p * n < p * m -> 0 < p
Nmult_lt_compat_rev_l2 : forall n m p : N, p * n < p * m -> n < m
Nmult_le_compat_l : forall n m p : N, n <= m -> p * n <= p * m
N.mul_le_mono_r : forall n m p : N, n <= m -> n * p <= m * p
N.mul_cancel_r : forall n m p : N, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p < -> n = m
N.mul_le_mono_pos_l : forall n m p : N, 0 < p -> n <= m < -> p * n <= p * m
N.mul_le_mono_nonneg : forall n m p q : N, 0 <= n -> n <= m -> 0 <= p -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q
N.mul_divide_cancel_r : forall n m p : N, p <> 0 -> (n * p | m * p) < -> (n | m)
N.gt_lt_iff : forall n m : N, n > m < -> m < n

```coq
intros n m p H.
apply Ngt_gt.
apply mult_gt_compat_rev_l1 with (p := N.to_nat p).
apply nat_of_P_gt_Gt_compare_morphism.
rewrite <- N.to_nat_succ, <- N.to_nat_succ in H.
apply gt_Ngt.
exact H.
Qed.
```

original: intros n m p H. apply Ngt_gt. apply mult_gt_compat_rev_l1 with (p := N.to_nat p). apply nat_of_P_gt_Gt_compare_morphism. rewrite <- N.to_nat_succ, <- N.to_nat_succ in H. apply gt_Ngt. apply H.
